page.title: 07DUKES FARM NEAR GURNARD.
page.content: Dukes Farm is in Rew Street. Mrs. Jollife and her brother Mr.Flux run it.It is a dairy farm and there are about 60 milking cows in the herd.At present they have Guernsey cows but they are changing to Friesans because people don't want the rich,creamy milk.They also keep beef cattle and pigs and there is a 7 year old Hereford bull called William which is kept in a pen.The crops they grow are corn and grass.The grass is used for feeding the cows and for silage.Silage is cut twice a year and is stored in the farmyard,covered by black plastic sheeting,with old tractor tyres on top to stop the sheeting blowing away in the wind. They also keep a few pigs,ducks and chickens for there own use.
